column4: I'm trying to get my friend's wlan card working and I'm kinda stuck. I've got card manager recognising the pcmcia card, and the ath_pci module loading, lspci shows it as an Atheros 802.11 device. The problem step is that I don't get a /dev/wlan0 file created. Anyone know what I'm doing wrong?
iwconfig shows the device? (net devices are not created in /dev/)
it just says that lo and sit0 don't have any wlan extensions
doesn't mention any other devices
and you are sure the atheros driver is loaded?
it shows up in lsmod and /var/log/messages
i do not know what can be wrong if the driver loads without errors the device should be listed in iwconfig -a or ifconfig -a
yeah, that was my thinking :(
sorry for not being of much help :(
sudo aptitude update && sudo aptitude dist-upgrade ?
I tried that first ;)
maybe there are still packages to dwonload
sometimes it takes a few runs of dpkg --configure -a to fix an interruted upgrade
I don't think that's the problem, it's quite happy to download new packages, but can't configure them because of dependencies on unconfigured packages
that's why i said you have to run dpkg --configure -a a few times in a row.
every time I run dpkg --configure -a I get the same error, lots of dependency warnings but starting with "dpkg: error processing debianutils (--configure):
so dependencies are being sattisfied
sudo aptitude reinstall debianutils
so I try aptitude reinstall debianutils which wants to download some stuff, but comes back with the error message I started with
I can follow instructions, the error message just leaves me completely flummoxed and google doesn't seem to help with the "due to missing arch" bit of it...
i'm out of ideas; sorry
that makes two of us, then :(
